body:
**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:
/kind bug

**What happened**:
I am running etcd-operator in kubernetes, and noticed that when I deleted the etcdcluster (Custom resource definition) the pods & services did not get cleaned up. I looked on another kube environment I had running, and on that env everything worked as expected. I checked logs, and could see on the env that was working I saw the following messages in Controller manager logs:
```
I0215 08:59:06.659783       1 garbagecollector.go:371] processing item [v1/Pod, namespace: etcd-operator, name: example-etcd-cluster-thcr8pfv89, uid: c9cdb6d7-122d-11e8-b4ac-068cfe9de373]
I0215 08:59:06.659871       1 garbagecollector.go:371] processing item [v1/Service, namespace: etcd-operator, name: example-etcd-cluster-client, uid: c9d238bc-122d-11e8-b4ac-068cfe9de373]
```
I didn't see these in the env that wasn't working, so I started looking at the garbage collector on there.

I noticed that there hadn't been any log message from garbage collecor since 31st Jan, when this was logged:
```
I0131 10:14:31.617880       1 controller_utils.go:1041] Waiting for caches to sync for garbage collector controller
```
Around this time we experienced some environmental network issues, which caused lots of errors around that time, such as:
```
E0131 10:13:31.691887       1 cronjob_controller.go:113] can't list Jobs: the server was unable to return a response in the time allotted, but may still be processing the request (get jobs.batch)
E0131 10:13:58.322978       1 node_controller.go:1022] Error updating node 10.143.115.218: the server was unable to return a response in the time allotted, but may still be processing the request (put n
odes 10.143.115.218)
E0131 10:14:31.617808       1 memcache.go:150] couldn't get current server API group list; will keep using cached value. (the server was unable to return a response in the time allotted, but may still b
e processing the request)
```

It looks like these issues may have caused the garbage collector to get into some sort of hung state?

When I restarted controller manager everything started working as expected.

**What you expected to happen**:
Garbage collector should have kept running, and working as expected.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
Not sure on the exact sequence that caused it, but suspect it was related to a time period when errors were occurring.

**Anything else we need to know?**:
We have `--leader-elect=false` set, and had previously hit this garbage collector issue -> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/issues/57044
However, we are running with Kube 1.8.6 with the fix for that issue cherry-picked (commit f5d5d18b2c2320e19ea3c0697c37a95d0009e628)


**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"8+", GitVersion:"v1.8.6-4+9c2a4c1ed1ee7e", GitCommit:"9c2a4c1ed1ee7e2e121203aa9a87315633a89eca", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-01-22T08:23:41Z", GoVersion:"go1.8.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"8+", GitVersion:"v1.8.6-4+9c2a4c1ed1ee7e", GitCommit:"9c2a4c1ed1ee7e2e121203aa9a87315633a89eca", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-01-22T08:23:41Z", GoVersion:"go1.8.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
IBM Cloud
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
Ubuntu "16.04.3 LTS (Xenial Xerus)"
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
4.4.0-78-generic #99-Ubuntu SMP Thu Apr 27 15:29:09 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
- Install tools:
- Others:

I will attach logs from Controller manager.

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG API Machinery.
labels.name: sig/api-machinery

title: Garbage collector in controller manager stops working
